intro: Calymmodon denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed calymmodon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in tropical botany and ecological adaptation.
